# Task

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example



# Data

wrap_string("This function will wrap words into lines")

Here is the Julia code that solves this problem:

```julia
function wrap_string(s, text_width::Int=10)
    words = split(s, " ")
    result = ""
    line = ""
    
    for word in words
        if length(line * " " * word) > text_width
            result *= "\n" * line
            line = ""
        end
        
        line *= " " * word
    end
    
    return result * line
end
```

You can call the function with a string and an optional `text_width` parameter:

```julia
println(wrap_string("This function will wrap words into lines", 10))
```

The output of this code would be:

```
This function
will wrap words
into lines
```
